result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report
Adjourned initial appearance on February 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Michael Murphy

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:20 AM Defendant Edward Barrios in court in custody at the Rock County Jail by video with attorney Jason D Sanders by video. Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Sanders states public defenders office has a conflict and needs to appoint new counsel. Parties argue bond. Court modifies bond to a signature bond set of $2,500.00 with modified conditions: No violent or disorderly conduct with victim: R.L. No contact directly or indirectly with victim B.P. B.D. or M.D., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Absolute Sobriety. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Curfew: must be in his residence from 6pm to 6am unless at work or driving to and from work. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 1pm.
